caption: Pizza is always cooked perfectly and tastes amazing.

Pat's is an awesome place with delicious thin crust pizza. Definitely in my top 5 in all of Chicago.  Today we came to pick up a pizza and they were running a little behind. The manager surprised us an threw in a bottle of wine. It's easy to see why they have been in business for 70ish years.  Haven't eaten inside but it looked like a small and cozy indoors with good booths for a pizza date.  Will definitely come in person this summer.

We drove into the city from Rockford illinois, i miss Chicago since I move out and up to Rockford. After a nice warm day at the Zoo and park I took my family and we went to Pat's Pizza for dinner. The pizza was fantastic and thin n crispy. My daughter loved the mac n cheese, my son, wife and I enjoy the pizza. Daughter enjoyed eating the cheese and sauce leaving the crust behind. I recommend this place and give thin crust a try. I will definitely come back when I am in town.

I use to eat here all the time but moved out of the area a few years back. I was able to come back for dinner and their service and food was amazing. The grilled calamari was so so good. Rogelio was great, he was super attentive and friendly. It’s important to not forget about places like this especially as we return back to dinning in. I’m happy I was able to stop in and of course their tavern pizza was delicious as always.
Friendly staff
Best thin crust pizza.
Great pizza

I just had a small pepperoni w/garlic pizza delivered. It cost $26! It was good...but not $26 good. It's pizza, not caviar. UPDATE So, the proprietor commented about not being "hip" enough. I don't know if he meant him or me and I'm not sure what that word is meant to convey.  Hip. I guess I'm not - nor  bright enough because I fail to see the relevance to outrageously, unjustifiably expensive this place is. PS When I hear something "all the time" in my professional endeavors, I'm glad to say I am capable of taking a good look figuring I'm missing something that other people can see.

Cold pizza, incompetent driver with bad condescending attitude. Told me I was lucky they even delivered the pizza to River North. I call the manager and he was rude and berated me for complaining the pizzas were cold. Waste of $50. Overrated   Too bad Covid didn’t put these clowns out of business. I should have read the other bad reviews!!

Bunch of rude service, food was Burnt and cold. Had a great time talking to there manager! He was a little kid that probably dropped out of high school. Oh wait I take that back... middle school. I recommend going to little Cesar we’re you have better service.
Great pizza, fantastic neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Our go to place. Everything good.
Top notch. A Chicago staple.
Favorite thin crust spot in Chicago!
Great local place
Great pie, gravy and amazing customer service
A very consistently delicious thin crust. Our go-to pizza place in Chicago.
Pizza tastes great... and staff is so sweet... a little expensive only
Love the regular thin crust and solid g-free option for those in our house with an allergy. Speedy delivery, too!
They forgot part of my order and were rude about it. Pizza was incredibly sub-par.
Great staff and incredible food a amazin kitchen

the crust was thin and good and the pizza which was a sausage pizza was NO QUESTION the worst i have ever had . i should have brought it back . i was too hungry so i ate 4 pieces and tossed it . what a shame $ 22 shot .
Pizza is delicious i also had the chicken sandwich which was very good
The thin crust pizza is arguably the best in chicago & the wine prices are amazing (half off bottles on Mondays 😯) to top it off, the service is the best. A must in chicago. Love pats so much

Placed an order on Uber Eats and after nearly 2 hours wait, the food didn’t show up. When I called at the 45 min mark they said they hadn’t even started the order and this was “an unusually busy night”. They never once contacted me to let me know of the delays. Unremarkable service, unremarkable pizza menu. Will not order from Pat’s again, especially when Chicago’s Pizza and Gino’s are nearby.

We placed an order at 7:36 and we're quoted a wait time of "approximately 60 minutes". Over 2 1/2 hours later we received our pizza after multiple phones calls promising it was nearby. Our pizza showed up ice cold and was delivered in a BAG! No way 2 1/2 hours is worth waiting for thin crust pizza in Chicago.

Delivery took over 2.5 hours... ordered at 7:36, called for an update at 8:45 and was told 30 min... called again at 9:30 and was told 5-10 min.... Called again at 9:50 again was told 5-10 min again. it is now 10:15, the pizza is here and freezing.  Not to mention they deliver pizza in a bag?

Owned and operated by the same family since 1950 it seems fair to call Pat’s Pizza and Ristorante an “institution,” and although both Chicago’s Pizza scene as well as the world itself have undergone unprecedented change over the last few years the Pizzeria at 2679 North Lincoln Avenue continues to focus on the fundamentals that have gotten them to where they are today.  Open seven days a week in Lincoln Park, just a few blocks from the Diversey Brown or Purple line, it is upon entry to the storied space lined in black & white photos that guests are greeted, socially distanced seating demarcated with all staff appropriately donning PPE.  Known for Tavern Style Pizza, or “Thin Crust” as Pat’s lists it on the menu, diners are additionally offered an array of Appetizers and Entrees plus three sizes of “Chicago Pan Pizza,” IE Deep Dish at about half the price of Lou’s, Uno or Gino’s.  Opting for the best of both worlds, the Pan taking longer to prepare and thus allowing adequate focus on each style hot from the oven, locals say one has not tasted a true “Cracker Crust” until they visit Pat’s, and far be it for this author to argue as the crisp base crackles to the tooth with pockets of air giving way to herbaceous Sauce, melted Cheese and crumbly but moist Fennel Sausage.  Apparently not the Restaurant’s original location, though the same oven is still responsible for each and every Pie, Pat’s deep dish comes extricated from its pan unlike other Chicago staples, and with Cheese better melted plus Crust richer with Butter the overall effect is a significant upgrade on more famous places without the tourists or lines.
Thin crust is the way to go here. We like the antipasto salad as well. Friends had shrimp Caesar salad and we're happy.
Very helpful and delicious
Super tasty pizza. Especially loved the thin crust Hawaiian, so different with the ricotta! Loved my takeout experience and will be back.
Best super thin crust pizza in the city. Awesome restaurant very family friendly.
Really delicious pizza and really light too. I ordered this as a late night snack (14”) and enjoyed it...also didn’t wake up feeling bloated. Quality food.
Some of the best thin crust in Chicago
Great pizza and other Italian dishes
Seriously delicious thin crust pizza. Will be a repeat customer no doubt. Check out the Pat’s Special!

I would normally give 5 stars for the great tasting pizza we normally get each time we order. But today, we ordered the same pizza and it took their driver over 30 minutes to make the delivery, which the pizza was ice cold! This of course made us microwave the pizza and it lost most of its great taste. Now, while we were waiting for the pizza, I called Pats and started to tell the lady who answered that we are waiting for the delivery guy who is 30 minutes late, then suddenly I was put on hold. I waited for 5 minutes still on hold and hung up and called back again. When the lady heard my voice, she again put me on hold again, unbelievable! Finally the phone rang and was told by our front desk that the pizza finally arrived so I hung up. Very uncalled for and very bad customer service for that I was put on hold for so long and twice too!!!

(Delivery review) Pizza was pretty average. Delivery came an hour later than promised. Owner was extremely rude when I called to ask about an ETA as if this the late delivery was okay. I wouldn’t recommend and don’t think it’s worth what my family went through to get it. Many better options on the northside of Chicago.
Ate the Parmason Chicken, it was good
Great pizza
Decent tasting pizza, but a little skimpy on the sauce, and too thin for my taste. But definitely worth a try at least once.

I have been using Pat's for years (about 30). They have the *BEST* pepperoni and great italian susage, so if you order any pizza with the above you will be in seventh heavan. Personally I am  a thin crust guy and Pat's really delivers as it is almost a cracker but it is really something to bite into.
This pizza place never changes flavor, one of the best in the city. Recommend it to all my latino people since we are known to be picky on the food we buy!!!

As you walk in, the place has an old Chicago feel.  It was pretty busy but we got seated right away at the only place left open. Even though it was busy our service was quick. We ended up getting just the bread and a large pizza, thin cracker crust, with half pepperoni and half sausage. To most, the "tavern style" pizza is traditionally a Chicago classic. The bread was a tasty appetizer and the pizza was excellent. To be honest, however, it was all about the crust of the pizza...not the toppings. There was nothing wrong with the pizza, but the toppings were the same as most any other pizza place in Chicago so it wasn't like this place was any more special than any other. However, the crust was so thin...and thats what this place does best.
Best in chicago
Great pizza and Service
Phenomenal thin crust pizza

Wow! This place is delicious! We got a the eggplant rolls as an appetizer and they were so good. Then we got a medium thin-crust with Italian Sausage (best I’ve had), meatballs, ricotta, and sun dried tomatoes and it was perfection! We’re two big guys and we had leftovers. Definitely don’t pass this place up!
The best thin crust I have found in the city
Only had pizza & fries both are good but pizza is the star.
If you want thin crust, this is the place to go.
Great very thin true Italian pizza!
Great pizza
Fantastic service and amazing pizza! Tried the meat lovers and Pat's special pizza, they each were top notch!
Cracker thin crust, stays straight as an arrow when held.
Great restaurant vibe and delicious thin crust pizza.  The giant roll of bread with pizza sauce and butter that comes with the meal is wonderful.
Great pizza and bread. But they were out of a lot of the beers we ordered.
The Quattro formaggio is absolutely excellent. Never would have expected I'd enjoy blue cheese on a pizza
Their cracker thin crust is incredible. I also love the classic restaurant look and feel.
Went a bit after they opened, assuming fresh pizza. No, it was old pizza. Alot of socializing not much working.
Too expensive for reheat old pizza, can tell its old from look and taste.

This is an excellent local place. I love going here. The food is amazing and it has an amazing story. The pizza is delicious and incredibly well cooked. The dough is soft, light and airy. The sauce is well cooked and well made with fresh ingredients. The staff is incredibly friendly and genuinely cares about the customers and their experience. I also had the house salad and it was so good, especially with the dressing. The pasta was also well cooked. It was flavorful and vibrant. Good local place and would definitely recommend.

Disappointing. I'm giving this 2 stars.  Pizza was blah, nothing special, ordered a pep+sau thin crust and wings.  No taste on the pizza and the wings were just meah.  Would give 3 stars but given this was $35, I expected more.  Not recommended.
Didn't live up to the hype. But it was fun exploring the area.
My wife and I tried Pats for the first time Saturday night and loved the food. We tried the thin crust  pepperoni, onion, bell pepper,  mushroom, and sausage. The crust was awesome!! Try it!!
Best thin crust pizza. Will definitely go back.
I love this place been going to this place for over 20 years very good food.
Thin crust pizza was pretty good but rather expensive.
Excellant thin crust pizza!
Delicious pizza. Been around for yrs. Love it!
Great thin crust pizzas with very reasonable price and excellent service. Will def recommend!
Grate food and service
Food was really good and Kat was awesome :)
Best thin crust!!
Tasted like salt and grease. Terrible. Now It's time for a Trump like condescending, irrelevant response in 3, 2, 1...

Went on Thursday evening. Waited at front door to be seated for 5 minutes because no one seamed to be working. Finally got seated by someone.  Said waiter would be there soon. Only 4 tables of diners. Waited 10 minutes before waiter delivered something to table next to us and said he’d be right back. Waiters came and went to other tables. Looked at us but did nothing. 10 minutes later we got up and left. Horrible customer service. Will never return.
Go here for their excellent thin crust pizzas. And they provide crayons to draw on their tables with.
One of the best thin pizzas in Chicago! Excellent friendly service and warm family atmosphere.
Always a great time and food is good too; but my wife's grilled pork was abit dry this time.
Love this place pizza 😍💗
Great food
Had the meat lovers pizza, very good and chicken tenders were very good !
Great staff and pizza

Greatest  place for pizza,pasta,chicken  fingers. Wife used  to  get heartburn from other  pizza places. NO  HEARTBURN  FROM PAT'S  PIZZA EVER. THEY USED  TO BE ON SHEFFIELD.    AS AND OLD SAYING  GOES HAPPY WIFE HAPPY  LIFE.
Delicious! Delicious!
Attentive, very family friendly. The pizza is thin crust and crunchy.
Long walk but worth it
Really crowded, it was good, some rude Karen took our reservation seat but other than that fine
Awesome pizza and great staff.
Nice restaurant. Friendly service.
This is my favorite Italian restaurant in all of Chicago. The people are amazing, the food is delicious, and the atmosphere of the restaurant makes you feel at home.
Generous portions. Friendly staff. Pizza has very thin, tasty crust and lots of toppings. Salads are top notch. Definite return!

First time in Chicago,  first time for pub style pizza. Tried a couple kinds, giardiniera and Sausage. Both had great flavor and the sauce was great,  the crust is just a little thin and crispy for my likes. But I would say a must try when in chicago.
The toppings tasted good, but they over cooked my crust.  I will be returning to Pat's, but I'll mention the crust and beside that the staff is very friendly
Double the delivery time and still waiting
This place has been there forever!! Grab a pizza and go to Rose's (across the street) for a cold beer
Very, very thin crust pizza. If you like thin crust pizza it's great! Charming atmosphere.

This place was nice service was great and friendly.The pizza was just ok it really didn't have any flavor , the sauce was tasteless .This was unfortunate because I really wanted to like this place . I couldn't give it any higher ratting because it is a pizza place, although I liked the couple of apps we ordered pizza just didnt cut it.

Great crispy pizza crust...! The baked goat cheese appetizer was also good. :) ----- Caution: Tonight, I was asked to pay ~$5 more than the total price listed on their website as "we were dining in". According to the waitress who was helping us, the dine-in & take-out prices in Pat's are different with dining in being more expensive!  Eventually and after I talked to them about the check, they threw in a $5 discount coupon, but that misses the point: I had never seen this issue in any restaurant, ever! Thinking of setting a price difference (and assuming it is legit), it should actually be the other way around; I can think of a million reasons why they should be encouraging people to dine in, by making it cheaper...  UPDATE (March 2019):  Don't get me wrong; the food here is superb! However, always make sure to triple-check the check against menu prices. Similar discrepancies to what I wrote before have happened to me here. I wish this was one of those places you can fully  trust in this regard.

Great food, excellent service! We actually ended up going there by accident as we were looking for another place but we instead found this. A pleasant surprise and we could not have been more pleased with the quality of food and service we received!
Great thin crust pizza. We ended up eating slices like potato chips, just one after another.
Fresh pizza made to order, they even have gluten free options. Highly recommended for occasions with big groups for a fun atmosphere with awesome decor and food.
Great assortment of the best thin crust pizzas which is great with wine. The Nick's have got it going on in this long time, family owned Chicago restaurant.
Excellent delivery service, great to dine in as well.  best part- they have a dog friendly patio, and serve dog "meatballs" for your canine companion!  Love this pizza joint, great thin crust pizza.
Very good pizza. Sauce is a little on the sweeter side, and the service was excellent. Haven't had the deep dish, but maybe on the next visit

Such a perfect restaurant! The price is great and they have the best thin crust in all of Chicago. I've been there too many times to count and have never had a bad experience. All of the waitstaff is fantastic as well. I would recommend to anyone at anytime!
Best Chicago-style tavern thin crust in the area/North Side. Sausage, as always, is the way to go. Close to some great bars for pizza eating.
Maybe we caught you on a bad night? Our order was incomplete, and I thought the pizza a little crusty... I'll give you another go and change my review if it's better?

The best thin crust in Chicago! Its paper thin, crisp even filled with ingredients!  Hands down! Gina & staff make you feel a part of the family! The owner carries her family's legacy down, honors her father, Pat with upholding superb Italian dishes! A must go!

Took my nephew for pizza tonite service was not great had to wait long for our coffee asked for extra cream did not receive it pizza was good but lousy staff was not even asked if we wanted a refill on coffees.  Will think twice before i go back.  Disappointed....
Great thin crispy pizza, rnuce atmosphere and really attentive staff! This was my first visit but definitely not my last! The pasta choices on the menu were amazing!
Best thin crust in the usa..
People were excellent. Gave great history behind the business and location
Amazing thin crust pizza. Best in Chicago. Hands down!!

The pizza was amazing. We caught them on a bad night. Only 2 front house staff and it was packed. They had to seat, take orders, serve and buss every table. Not their fault but management's. Still once it cleared out we had a great time and the food was legendary.
Pizza was thin crust very good decent service. Wanted a single glass of wine but had to buy a bottle, so ended up getting pretty drunk, all in all a fun night
Delicious thin crust pizza. And perfect mozzarella sticks.
Pricey good thin Pizza

Absolutely fabulous experience........ from the food to the service. I can now say proudly that I have been to Pat's Pizza. My daughters were in town, and we finally got to try it. We couldn't decide between a few pasta dishes, and the pizza. So we just got a little bit of everything!!! Mark is amazing! You are fortunate to have him..... we shall return!
Great food!!!

Pat's is (and probably always will be) on my short list of places to eat when I come home visit Chicago, from Colorado. My question: Is the N. Lincoln Ave. Pat's (the one I love) related to the S.Clark street Pat's (never been there)? Please advise. Thank you;j
Been hearing how good this pizza is for years and finally tried it tonight. Wish I had sooner. Very good thin crust .
The pumpkin ravioli are to die for

This is my very 1st time picking up pizza from here, great experience! Mark is a very hospitable man,pizza is absolutely Delicious and I'm writing this review as I eat my pizza in my car cause after the first slice I couldn't wait to get home lol. You guys are all just Fantastic👍👍
If you're looking for cracker crust, this is the spot. Great service and great pizza.
Great pizza. Friendly atmosphere
What a place.  Authentic thin crust Chicago Pizza at it's best.  Look no further, your evening has arrived.
Good pizza and delivered in about 15 minutes. I’m all set with this place going forward! Thanks 👌👍
Deee Lish!
The Best! Try the Quattro formaggi thin crust!(comes with crushed garlic!) All their thin crust, pan and stuffed pizzas are true Chicago pizzas. And they're pastas are terrific.
Great pizza,average salad
Great food
One of the best I've ever had

Wee seen on chicagos best that this was the best thin crust. Well its nice and thin but bland as hell no spice in suasage no tast very drie. So we ate and got up and freaked out when we were paying. The waiter took our credit card to the bak in the kitchen to swipie the card ! Then we noticed no cash register no were in the restuarnt its in the kitchen yes i said the kitchen! Im sorry not in this time and life!! Is anyone going to take my credit catd to onether room. Hell know. Never go bk. Beaware or ur going to c  after u get riped off  .
It's one of the best thin crusts in Chicago.

We had heard of Pat's Pizza and decided to give it a shot last weekend. While the Pizza was fine, mainly because of the crust I still cannot give this place more than one star because of the service. They might make decent pizzas but that doesn't matter if you simply don't receive what you ordered? When I confronted the server who messed up our order he simply gave me the toppings on the side! Mmmhhhh?!? If I want my toppings on the side then I don't need to order a pizza in the first place! We also were not offered a compensation for the ruined order. In the end there are better pizza places in Chicago like Coalfire or Craft Pizza, just skip this one!!!
Great pizza
Liked it.  Friendly staff.
Crispy thin crust perfectly cooked pizza, nice antipasto, grilled calamari appetizer was fantastic . Service left a little to be desired but after all it's a pizza joint, so who cares.😁

The best thin crust, its seriously paper thin yet so full of flavor! Plenty of other apps and entree’s to choose from if youre not feeling like pizza, like their fresh pastas! Always have great service, Mark is always making sure every guest is satisfied and happy. This place truly feels like a hidden gem in Chicago.
The italian pizza pats pizza location is very good.famous with thin crust pizza and it is delicious.You can get your orders just in time
Disappointed. Waste of $30 plus tip as the pizza arrived cold and the crust was overcooked. It was like eating cold cheese on burnt cardboard. Definitely not ordering from this place again.
Top thin crust (tavern style) pizza. Great Italian menu.
The Best !
Best thin crust in Chicago, and lordy I've tried them all. If you're a St. Louis expat this isn't Imo's but it's close enough (and delicious in it's own, different way)
Great pizza and salad. Would definitely return.
My longtime neighbor recommended this pizza and we just tried it. Wow! Authentic Chicago thin crust with just the right sauce.  No need to hesitate. It will not disappoint!

We had a phenomenal meal. So glad malnati's line made us turn around and go back to Pat's.  The chicken vesuvius was so so so delicious,  crispy and smothered in a delicious sauce paired with peas, roasted peppers and roasted potato wedges. My mushroom fettuccine was buttery deliciousness with crispy asparagus and tender pork chunks. And on top of a delicious meal (which we will have again tomorrow) the server Cat was outstanding and so friendly.  One of the kitchen staff came out to talk to us too, cuz we're tourists from Florida and not locals, and they gave us an order of calamari to take home!  Amazing.  Skip Malnati's,  have an excellent Italian meal in a friendly family restaurant!
Great thin crust pizza..
Incredible pizza, incredible service. Pat's Pizza was 5 stars across the board, from the delicious thin crust to the fantastic customer service. I highly recommend giving it a try!

The best thin crust pizza I've ever had! Love their thin crust! I order delivery from them on GrubHub and they are quick (considering their generous delivery zone) and pizza always arrives hot and perfect every time. Also, they have the greatest customer service! Tonight I missed the delivery drivers call by accident and instead of him leaving, I got a call a minute later which I happened to hear from Pat's saying the driver was outside. Whoever called me was such a nice guy...very sweet, seemed like maybe the owner. I'm officially a BIG fan and can't wait to finally check it out in person. A real gem!
Nice ma and pa neighborhood  place,great menu with tasty specials.the service staff is so helpful  and spot on to all your needs.pats earns a yummy 5 stars.
friendly staff and good thin crust. sauce a little sweet
If you love thin crust pizza this is the place. Cracker thin and crispy. Service was average but with the good food I can ignore that.
For me the pizza was ok.  I was expecting a lot.  Service was incredible.
Love this place!  Great service.  Great portions.  You leave stuffed with leftovers!  I love the salad and also the warm baked bread.
Good service and good pizza.
Awesome pizza! Fast, friendly service
You can taste love in their food. Absolutely worth the long wait for cooking.
Great place, great food and amazing service!!!
Great food and service. Very reasonable prices. Ask for Eric a great waiter.
Great thin crust pizza, delicious and great service as well.
Amazing food and service! Such a homey and quaint local place! Get Pat’s thin crust pizza!
Excellent service and delicious thin crust Chicago tavern size pizza.
We drive from Milwaukee for Pats. Always so good.  The thin crust pizza... to die for.  Must try pumpkin ravioli
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago.

I was quite disappointed in the pizza I had here not crispy at all more soggy and limp. It is very thin really too thin, and the waiter didn’t know what Italian sausage was, I’m not kidding we order sausage pizza and got Italian beef. The beef was not good either dry and old, we sent it back.
Great and timely service, great portions, selections and taste, nice ambience and very clean bathrooms.
The food was very good, one the best pizzas I've tasted and Mundo was really good. I would come back return visit.
Best pizza ever!!!
Best pizza I've ever had. If I never eat a different pizza again, I'd be ok with that.
We love Pat's thin crust pizza.  It's the best!  Also, we always get their grilled calamari.
Oh. My. God. Tried it out because of a coupon, and now have a full on addiction. Best pizza I've ever had, fast delivery. Get the meat lovers.
Best cracker crust pizza on the north side.
Great Pizza and Better Service
Amazing pasta. I had chicken marsala and could not stop eating it. One of the best I've had. The pizza was good. Fried ravioli was tasty too. Service was good but not great.
Great pizza. Good family friendly atmosphere. I recommend their grilled calamari app.
They have the best thin crust pizza... If you like it really thin and crispy, this is the best place so far that we've found.
Great thin crust

The food is good, however, every time we pick up, the order isn't right. For the 3rd time in a row we didn't get any dressings for the salad, or the extra sauce we ordered and paid for.  This time the soup we ordered also wasn't  right.
This pizza is incredible! Don't miss out!
Excelent

Really decent pan pizza. If you order an app they will bring bread if you ask. Warm loaf is so good. The service is pretty decent. Drinks are ok but solid effort to make whatever you want. We got sangria! But who does that? Haha but ended up being decent. The baked clams i ordered were simply not good do not order those. The house salads were very good and fresh tasting. Overall good place, I will be back.
I had thin crust and it was very good. Best pizza sauce I've had in a long time. Definitely going back.
Best thin crust pizza in the city Period!!! Dining room is low key and great. You can also get pizza to go!
The food is delicious.  The portions are generous.  Expext to pay around $20 or more for entres (which includes tips and tax).
Decent pizza if you're desperate. I disagree with the other reviewer who said this is the world's best thin crust.
Best thin crust pizza in the city!!!
Always enjoy Pat's, I love their pizza.
Great neighboorhood Italian eatery.  Of course the pizza is delicious, at times they keep 11 delivery men busy.  Try the other dishes, too.
Best pizza in the city

One of my all time favorite pizza joints in Chicago (and that's saying a lot!). Probably the best thin crust pizza in the world. That's right, the world. Also the old-world ambiance is both romantic and relaxing.
(Translated by Google) Super delicious food and great service👍  (Original) Super rica la comida y buenísimo servicio👍
Thin cracker crust, grid cuts. Great for family outings.

We get pizza from here way too often, but its good and they keep us coming back. Fresh ingredients for the toppings. Usually pretty fast service for pick-up. Never actually eaten inside the place, but I have tried things other than pizza on their menu and have liked all the Italian dishes.
Best thin pizza!
Good thin crust, but not quite on par with some of the tavern style cracker crusts at a few places in the city.
Great pizza
I have eaten here many times.  It is a very down to earth, relaxing neighborhood establishment.  Great crusty Italian bread and marinera sauce served with dinner.  Famous thin crust pizza. Enjoy!!
Pizza is great and so are the people.
it is ok
Love thin crust and this was amazing. New go to
Phenomenal food
Standard family pizza joint.  Very reasonably priced and food was pretty good.
Best. Thin. Crust. Ever.

Deep dish pizza was great! Waiter was courteous, but not overly friendly. Didn't bug or ignore us. I would eat here again all the food smelled wonderful. Not a fast food place, take a friend and have a conversation before during and after your meal.
Food was outstanding, the atmosphere remind you of a small restaurant in Italy and the service was really pleasant. I will go back again.

We got the wings and thin sliced pizza. The wings were so salty and covered in oil. I do not recommend, my stomach is already starting to hurt. The cheese on pizza tastes fake and filled with preservatives. Will not be getting pizza from here again.

I'm giving this place a 2 because I haven't tasted anything too impressive here. To be fair I only had this pizza once. I got a 16 inch pizza to go, by the time I got home the pizza was cold. I say the pizza was cold, not to blame pat's but to communicate the fact that I didn't get Pat's at its best moment. I know hot pizza is better, maybe next time?  As I said, I wasn't impressed by the taste, what really surprised me is the pizza size. This pizza is very thin. You might love thin pizza, I like thin pizza, but not this thin. The pizza crust here seems thinner than a saltine. The sauce seemed non existent and the cheese was pretty scarce as well. A big guy like me can eat this 16 inch pizza pretty easily. The thing is it'll cost you around 20 dollars. For that amount of money you can go get a steak or a more filling meal.  I'll prob go back to try the pasta though because the establishment looked nice. It seemed very clean and the staff seemed friendly.

Waited 20 minutes to be offered menus and drinks another 20 for food, had to ask another waiter for refills. Hipster yuppie vibe- if that's not you you will get crap service. Pizza was by far not Chicago Best either.
Just okay. Took 1.5x longer for delivery than estimated. I'd rather have D'ags
This pizza was over cooked and well I will not say s**Ked. From what I hear the owner is not even around anymore.
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago.
Pat's is the best!! You have to get the thin crust pizza they're famous for! The service is great and the portions are huge, what more could you ask for?
Best Thin Crust in Chicago

Food was excellent. Our waiter sucked, spent most his time in the kitchen talking to the cooks and paid no attention would whether or not we needed anything. The door guy/bus boy was amazing and kept checking on us, therefore he got a tip..the waiter got a small tip. Their homemade sauce us delicious.

Crispy and chewy crust from the edge to the center and never a sauggy piece in between. It's gooey cheese is salty and creamy, the sauce is rich and vibrant and the toppings are plentiful but still balanced. On point pizza....

Excellent experience! Food was authentically Italian. Service was great with the whole staff. Excellent selection of beer and wine with the great Italian food. When were in Chicago we're going to Pat's.
Great food 💯

I've been going to Pat's for over 20 years from the time they were located on Sheffield. I've never had a bad meal there, nor bad service. The location on Lincoln is cozy and friendly, and the food is excellent, especially the non-pasta meat entrees. My favorites are the pork Milanese, an Italian-style breaded pork tenderloin with mashed potatoes and buttery pork gravy (order extra gravy!) with grilled veggies and a salad. You always get a loaf of fresh-baked crusty bread. The pasta is OK, just not my favorites.

BEST PIZZA IN CHGO.... I've been eating Pats pizza since 1952, age of 4-5. My parents knew Nick and we ordered 2- 3 a week. I've moved around the US, And recently moved back to the area. Pats has changed locations but it's the same Great pizza....keep up the good work Liz......Pj..... ; )

There are only a handful of good pizza places that deliver to the loop past 8:00 on weekdays and Pat's is one of them. They have some of the best thin crust in Chicago and this is without a doubt my go to place. Be advised, their thin crust is really thin - on par with Homemade Pizza Co. - and you can get creative with their toppings. It can be a bit pricey but, if you're like me and order multiple times a month when your wife is out of town, the non-expiring, $2.00 off coupon on the back on the menu helps.
Absolutely the BEST thin crust pizza anywhere. Always worth the trip!
Best thin crust in the city. This family friendly restaurant always has great welcoming feel, high quality ingredients and delicious food!

Great garbage salad (double turkey no ham) and warm bread with marinara,  Love their fried ravioli appetizer and they make the best thin crust pizza in chicago, don't even bother asking for pie-cut, they won't do it for you.
Very good salads and I enjoyed the toasted ravioli.   The thin crust is extra thin and very tasty!

Its the best thin crust in the city in my opinion.  Definitely expensive but they have coupons that go out in your local mailers all the time that will bring down the price.  My suggestion is to try pepperoni, goat cheese, and red peppers.  They do it right and it's a solid pie.  I always get delivery, and have not been to the restaurant.
Gnocci with prosciutto is fantastic. So is the pat's special thin crust. If you order take out, you might even get some free soft serve while you wait.
